This is an on-call, shared ride van service which is available for transportation to and from NYU facilities during the Academic Term from 12 midnight to 6:30am. The average wait time for a van is 15 minutes, but wait times during busy periods may be longer.   If you require transportation during these hours, please use the NYU Mobile app on your smart phone or call the Department of Public Safety at (212) 992-VANS (992-8267) . A van operated by Academy Bus will be dispatched to transport you.   Passengers are expected to be ready to board their Safe Ride van safely yet promptly when the van arrives. Passengers may monitor the locations of Safe Ride vans in the real time map .          To access the Safe Ride Service electronically, download the NYU Mobile app below by clicking on your operating system:                                                                        Feedback Form                             Service Announcements                                      Finals Period 2015 Safe Ride Route Service   (May 3rd-May 18th)                                                    NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. NYU Rudin Center for Transportation | Exploring challenges in transportation and infrastructure                                                                                                          NYU Rudin Center for Transportation             Search                  Primary Menu       Skip to content       Home   About the Rudin Center      Our Team       Events   Press   The Mobility Factbook   Publications   Blog Archive                                        Search for:                                                                               data , event , leaders , NYC , photos , taxis , technology , Uncategorized           Taxi Shift-Change Hackathon: Event Recap                            event , leaders , NYC , photos , Uncategorized           Excellence in Transportation Breakfast                            jobs , publication , sarah , transit           Mobility, Economic Opportunity and New York City Neighborhoods                                                 architecture , bikes , NYC , photos , Reading Material , transit , Uncategorized , urban planning         What we’re reading this week          May 1, 2015  Sarah Kaufman     Leave a comment                  Image above: Cardboard apartment, via Andere Achterhuizen  on Flickr   This is what we’re reading this week on the web:     New Yorkers are ditching buses for subways ( link )   Middle East politics: now arriving at a station near you? ( link )   Afghan girls, forbidden from riding bikes, are skateboarding instead. ( link )   A MetroCard redesign we’re excited about ( link )   The bright lights of NYC may dim ( link )   Cortland St. station on 1 line receives a long overdue facelift  ( link )       Compiled by Sean Lewin, research assistant. The Port Authority Is a Daily Disaster          April 29, 2015                Bloomberg Business   Share this:  Email  Facebook  Twitter  LinkedIn  Tumblr  More   Print  Reddit  Pinterest  Google                          New York’s Subway Madness          April 28, 2015                The New York Times   Share this:  Email  Facebook  Twitter  LinkedIn  Tumblr  More   Print  Reddit  Pinterest  Google                          Times Editorial Board Demands Cuomo Make Subways Less Miserable          April 26, 2015                Gothamist   Share this:  Email  Facebook  Twitter  LinkedIn  Tumblr  More   Print  Reddit  Pinterest  Google                                        air travel , architecture , bikes , NYC , Reading Material , transit , Uncategorized , urban planning         What we’re reading this week          April 24, 2015  Sarah Kaufman     Leave a comment                  Image above: Cars being transported across Ireland in 1950, via the National Library of Ireland on Flickr   Aside from subway overcrowding and taxi data hacking , this is what we’re reading this week on the web:     The LaGuardia Airport renovation is in jeopardy, again. ( link )   Indego, Philadelphia’s new bike share, opens today with 600 bicycles; users are encouraged to wear helmets. ( link )   A new United Nations-adjacent residential tower will feature full-floor “floating gardens.” ( link )   Cargo bikes are the new minivans. ( link )   The hipster express: more L trains to start running this fall. ( link )     Thanks to Sean Lewin, our new research assistant, for compiling this list.
